summary: In this context, Butane-2,3-dione is indirectly related to respiratory physiology through its association with lung function changes observed in workers exposed to flavoring agents. The discussion focuses on the effects of exposure on spirometry and diffusing capacity, indicating that certain chemicals, potentially including Butane-2,3-dione, may contribute to respiratory issues like obliterative bronchiolitis. However, the specific role of Butane-2,3-dione in respiratory physiology is not explicitly detailed.
